name: Flanking
description: When a creature and at least one of its allies are adjacent to an enemy and on opposite sides or corners of the enemy's space, they each have Advantage on melee attack rolls against that enemy. The flanking ally must not have the Incapacitated condition and must be within 5 feet of the target.

mechanics.benefit: Advantage on melee attack rolls against the flanked creature

positioning.requirement: Attacker and at least one non-Incapacitated ally must be on opposite sides or corners of the target's space
positioning.distance: Both must be within 5 feet of the target

mechanics.largeCreatures: For creatures larger than Medium, opposite sides or corners are measured across the full extent of the target's space. The DM adjudicates whether positioning qualifies.
limitations: Does not apply to ranged attacks
Does not apply if the flanking ally has the Incapacitated condition
Reach weapons do not qualify if the attacker is more than 5 feet away
Multiple flanking allies do not stack beyond a single instance of Advantage

interactions: Advantage from flanking and Disadvantage from another source (e.g., not seeing the target) cancel each other out, resulting in a straight roll
A Prone creature can still provide flanking as long as it is not Incapacitated and is within 5 feet on an opposite side
An Invisible ally on the opposite side still provides flanking since it depends on physical positioning, not visibility
Features that trigger on having Advantage (such as Sneak Attack) benefit from flanking Advantage
Solo monsters become significantly easier to defeat when flanking is enabled; DMs should consider adjusting encounter difficulty
